David Ford: There Is A Light

<strong>Rating:</strong> * * * * There's nothing quite like a cover version of a much loved song to cause a little debate, especially when its creators were The Smiths.

Kate Nash: Pumpkin Soup

<strong>Rating:</strong> * * * It will undoubtedly be played on Radio 1 and the Topshop stereo, then it's a reasonably enjoyable, and enjoyably short, three minute pop song.

Hot Chip, 'Ready For The Floor'

<strong>Rating:</strong> * * I never really got Hot Chip. Apart from their obvious indie-dance hybrid 'Over and Over', they seem to be a band suffering from genre identity issues.

In-depth

By James Bithell

If names like Fat Freddy's Drop, The Black Seeds, Kora or Little Bushmen mean something to you then you're part of a special minority in Britain.

James Cousins

No hurdle is too great to overcome in the grand scheme of The Great Band Reunion.

Eighties Matchbox B-Line Disaster: Fibbers

Their high-energy set list showcased a lot of new material, evoking the throbbing basslines, tribal drumming and screaming of their debut 'Horse of the Dog'. If performances of this calibre continue then surely wider recognition can't be far away.

Moishe's Bagel: National Centre for Early Music, York

Who needs to see the stage when a "rip-roaring, foot-stomping, jazz-inflected" band are strutting their stuff?

Beirut: Leeds Irish Centre

Beirut are far more at home than one would expect within these dignified yet staid surroundings.

Arcade Fire: Newcastle Metro FM Arena

It became apparent that as well as an abundance of musical talent in their onstage arsenal, the band have a pair of sex symbolsin the form of married couple Win Butler and Regine Chassagne.

Kylie Minogue: 2 Hearts

Brand New: (Fork and Knife)

Reuben Teskey: Even Hitgirls Get the Blues

In Depth: Worldscape

"Musically, Worldscape utilised everything from traditional orchestral instruments through unfamiliar Eastern arrangements such as the fascinating Gamelan Orchestra, to objects that we would typically reject as rubbish"

On The Up: Operator Please

"This young band's rapid progress is highlighted by the calibre of the bands they have supported, with Arctic Monkeys and Kaiser Chiefs foremost on the list."

Control (Motion Picture Soundtrack)

"The soundtrack accompanying Anton Corbijn's effortlessly stylish Ian Curtis biopic 'Control' clearly has one vital thing in its favour from the outset - the subject of the film itself."

Hast thou deserted us, Yorkshire muse?

"There are many reasons why a thriving campus music scene is desirable for both students and the University alike."

'Blame the f***ing government'

Foreign Beggars encapsulates everything good about UK hip hop.

Bestival - Isle of White - 07/09/07-09/09/07

Bestival has successfully carved out a special niche for itself over the past few years; halfway between a village fete and a children's birthday party.

Alex Clegg - We Have Not Enjoyed Ourselves

After seeing his compelling show in York last year, the enthusiastic spectators would do well to ask themselves what has happened to the guitar-wielding and enigmatic Alex Clegg.

The Go! Team - The Manchester Ritz - 13/09/07

With its grubby glitter ball and Las Vegas inspired styling, you'd wonder if The Go! Team actually were taking to the stage tonight in Manchester's classiest venue.

Les Savy Fav - Let's Stay Friends

It is a recurring problem with reviews of 'alternative' bands that only those with an intimate knowledge of the genre will be able to really understand the review.

The untimely demise of the single?

Not that it is a surprise to you, though it may be to some, but the most played single of all time on British radio is 'Bohemian Rhapsody' by Queen.

On the Up: Simian Mobile Disco

Most of us were screaming 'Because We. Are. Your Friends' at the top of our lungs in sweaty indie rooms across the land.

Tuning - Brudnell Social Club Leeds - 12/10/07

On tour with the material from their third album Good Arrows, electronic-folksters Tunng will arrive at the fantastically intimate Brudenell Social Club on Thursday.

Iron & Wine - Manchester Academy 2 - 26/10/07

Listening to previous offerings of the bearded Sam Beam (better known in musical circles as Iron & Wine), it is clear why he has a special place in the hearts of alt-folk fans both sides of the pond.

Prinzhorn Dance School - You are the space invader

The Thrills - The Midnight Choir

The Thrills have jumped the sunny Californian ship in favour of "the worst neighbourhood in all of Canada". The reason being they wanted a more "intimate, reflective," album this time.

Beverley Knight - Queen of Starting Over

Mark ronson ft. Amy Winehous - Valerie

Continuing his attempt at world domination that began with being a white man making a successful hip hop song (2003's 'Ooh Wee') and now involves remixing Bob Dylan.

Take two: the Sophomore Album

Every time an artist releases a successful debut album or rests loftily on a respected back catalogue, the pressure is inevitably on to make a better and bolder musical statement than their initial efforts: the sophomore album.

David Ford: There Is A Light
